content.title: Intro
content.content: -ndil, -nil, -dil is a Quenya suffix added to names to indicate friendship, love, or devotion to an object, idea, grouping, course, occupation or spirit (Ainur) to which one is devoted for its own sake[1]

content.title: Etymology
content.content:
From the longer form -(n)dildo,[2] from Root NIL/NDIL.[3]

nildo means "friend".

content.title: Examples
content.content:
Eärendil/Eärnil = "Devoted to the Sea"
Amandil = "Friend of Aman"
Ornendil = "Friend of the Trees"
Valandil = "Devoted to the Valar"
Elendil = "Friend of the stars", also understood as "Elf-friend"
*Vardilmë = Possibly female form meaning "Friend of Varda"
Aulendil = "Friend of Aulë"
It also appears in Sindarin Edennil (adan) and Enerdhil (anar)
